citations.narrative:
The lorikeet aviary includes a tortoise pen with heating lights that the birds have access to. Temperature measured at the
surface of one light with an IR temperature probe was 208 F, hot enough to burn and injure the birds should they come
into contact with the lamp. The facility must ensure that the birds are protected from injury within their aviary.
Correct by 21 Sept 2023

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
Required complete records including the avian enrichment plan were not available for review at the time of inspection.
These documents serve to provide instruction for necessary and appropriate animal husbandry, veterinary care tasks, and
ensure accountability for animal inventory. The facility must ensure that these documents are completed and available for
review at the time of inspection.
Correct by October 19, 2023.

Two freezers used to store animal food had patchy black material adhered to the door seals, and one of those freezers
had an accumulation of food debris on the floor of the unit. An accumulation of waste feed and mold on the freezers used
to store animal feed may contaminate the food or prevent proper functioning of the unit. The facility must ensure that
equipment used for storage of food is kept clean.
Correct by 21 September 2023.

All walls in the aviary were damaged and had evidence of chewing and wear down to the underlying drywall, preventing
proper cleaning and sanitation. The rubber seal around the aviary doors was not intact, and appeared to be damaged by
chewing. Exposed and damaged surfaces can harbor microorganisms and may expose birds to toxic materials when
chewed on, which may adversely affect animal welfare. The facility must ensure the the surfaces are kept in good repair.
Correct by October 19, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.150(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The lorikeet aviary includes a tortoise pen with heating lights that the birds have access to. Temperature measured at the 
surface of one light with an IR temperature probe was 208 F, hot enough to burn and injure the birds should they come 
into contact with the lamp. The facility must ensure that the birds are protected from injury within their aviary. 
 
Correct by 21 Sept 2023 
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
Required complete records including the avian enrichment plan were not available for review at the time of inspection. 
These documents serve to provide instruction for necessary and appropriate animal husbandry, veterinary care tasks, and 
ensure accountability for animal inventory. The facility must ensure that these documents are completed and available for 
review at the time of inspection. 
 
Correct by October 19, 2023. 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
Two freezers used to store animal food had patchy black material adhered to the door seals, and one of those freezers 
had an accumulation of food debris on the floor of the unit. An accumulation of waste feed and mold on the freezers used 
to store animal feed may contaminate the food or prevent proper functioning of the unit. The facility must ensure that 
equipment used for storage of food is kept clean. 
 
Correct by 21 September 2023. 
3.150(c)(2) 
   
Facilities, general.

All walls in the aviary were damaged and had evidence of chewing and wear down to the underlying drywall, preventing 
proper cleaning and sanitation. The rubber seal around the aviary doors was not intact, and appeared to be damaged by 
chewing. Exposed and damaged surfaces can harbor microorganisms and may expose birds to toxic materials when 
chewed on, which may adversely affect animal welfare. The facility must ensure the the surfaces are kept in good repair. 
 
Correct by October 19, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
